introduction.p: Consider a bond with a face value of 1000, a coupon rate of 10%, maturing in 5 years, with a redemption amount of 1250. The bond is priced to yield 12%.
Determine which of the following statements are true, and for those that are false, correct them.

task.p: At the end of five years, the issuer will pay the bondholder 1000.
There will be 5 coupons.
Each coupon will be 100.
The bond is priced by discounting the cash flows at an effective annual interest rate of 10%.
Coupons are calculated by finding 12% of 1250.

task.p: A bond with annual coupon payments is priced to yield an effective annual rate of 4%. The price is 10,445.18. The bond has a face value of 10,000 and is redeemed at par in five years. Find the coupon rate.

introduction.p: For each of the following bonds, determine whether the bond is priced at a discount, at par, or at a premium. Justify your answer. In addition, find the amount of discount or premium, as appropriate.

task.p: A bond has a face value of 1000, a coupon rate of 5%, a yield rate of 6%, and matures in 10 years. The bond is redeemed at par.
A bond has a face value of 1500, a yield rate of 3%, a coupon rate of 5%, and matures in 5 years. The bond is redeemed at par.
A bond has a a face value of 500, a redemption amount of 750, a coupon rate of 10%, a yield rate of 8%, and matures in 8 years.
A bond has a face value of 10,000, a coupon rate of 8%, a yield rate of 8%, and matures in 2 years. The bond is redeemed at par.
A bond has a face value of 1000, a redemption amount of 1250, a coupon rate of 5%, a yield rate of 5%, and matures in 7 years.

statement.p: A bond that is redeemed at par has a face value of 2500. The coupon rate is 5% and the yield rate is 4%. The bond matures in 2 years.
Create the amortization schedule for this bond, and state whether the bond is being written up or written down.
A bond that is redeemed at par has a face value of 1000. The coupon rate is 6% and the yield rate is 8%. The bond matures in 2.5 years.
Create the amortization schedule for this bond, and state whether the bond is being written up or written down.

introduction.p: For each of the following bonds, find the interest due and the principal repaid in the specified payment k, and find the book value immediately following the kth payment. In addition, state whether the principal repaid is either the amount for amortization of premium or the amount for accumulation of discount.

task.p: The bond is redeemed at par and has a face value of 1000. The coupon rate is 8% and the yield rate is 12%. The bond matures in 4 years, and k = 5.
The bond is redeemed at par and has a face value of 10,000. The coupon rate is 6% and the yield rate is 6%. The bond matures in 5 years, and k = 7.
The bond is redeemed at par and has a face value of 1000. The coupon rate is 10% and the yield rate is 8%. The bond matures in 10 years, and k=12.

introduction.p: For each of the following bonds, find the difference between the book value and the market value immediately after the given payment (i.e., find |B_k - MV_k|).

task.p: A bond has a face value of 1000 and is redeemed at par, the coupon rate is 5%, matures 5 years after it was issued, and was originally priced to yield 7.5%. Immediately after the 3rd payment, yield rates fall to 6%.

A bond has a face value of 10,000 and is redeemed at par, the coupon rate is 8%, matures 10 years after it was issued, and was originally priced to yield 6%. Immediately after the 12th payment, yield rates rise to 7%.
